summary: Daratumumab-based regimens deliver 42% higher margins than other RRMM treatments. A 15% utilization increase could yield $385,000/year in additional margin.

clinical_impact.description: Daratumumab-based regimens provide substantial clinical benefits in relapsed/refractory multiple myeloma.

metrics.description: Overall survival benefit vs. non-Daratumumab regimens

peer_comparison.description: Your practice uses Daratumumab-based regimens in only 34% of eligible RRMM patients, compared to 55% among peers. This represents a $450,000/year margin opportunity.

action_steps.text: Schedule RRMM regimen selection discussion with oncology team
Implement RRMM regimen margin dashboard by provider
Create automated alerts for eligible RRMM patients
Identify RRMM patients eligible for regimen optimization
Update order sets to prioritize Daratumumab-based regimens
Analyze supportive care impact on total regimen costs

suggestions.text: Optimize prior authorization processes for Daratumumab regimens
Develop infusion center capacity planning for longer infusions
